input: What does Section 40 of the IPC define?
target: Section 40 defines 'offense' as any act punishable by law.

input: Does Section 40 include acts punishable under local laws?
target: Yes, Section 40 includes acts punishable under local, special, or general laws.

input: Can an omission be an offense under Section 40?
target: Yes, an omission can be an offense if it is punishable by law.

input: Does Section 40 apply to civil wrongs?
target: No, Section 40 applies only to criminal acts punishable by law.
